reviews.review_msg: He's very confusing, his instructions make no sense and his opinions are very one sided and closed minded.

Shamshad is one of the best lecturers I have seen in the communications department. He is very knwoledgeable and really cares about your learning. He always comes to classes well prepared and encourages discussion. I am really enjoying this course and his teachings.
Dull but gives a lot of information.  Could be a little more generous in the  marking scheme.

Nawal truly is a great professor! I've seen some negative comments and I can say that's probably because you did something to disrupt her class. She's very passionate about the course material and wants you to do well. She's very clear about classroom policy and grading, she wants to see your understanding and research in papers and participation.
a true inspiration.
very friendly and helpful. He's there to help students.
would definately be my phone a friend on who wants to be a millionaire

Not really feeling he has prepared enough for lecturing, just copy the topic sentence from the textbook and paste on PowerPoint and read through it. But If you send a email, the respond is fast even an hour before midnight
great prof and great class. I can understand his lecture, which is so clear and helpful for my understanding of the course material

Really nice guy, truly cares about the topic and students... However, this class is super boring!! His accent is difficult to understand sometimes, and his PP slides don't make any sense. This makes for a very confusing lecture. Discussion is big, so be prepared to participate. Also, TA marks everything, so "difficulty" rating for him is irrelevant
He knows his course content and is passion about the topic.  Assignments are easy to complete, but take good notes in class.  Participation is necessary.

This prof is way over the top about China. He relates it to every topic he can and it feels like propaganda. He basically laughed at students if they didn't agree with his bizarre opinions. I recommend taking a different prof for this class.

Guoxin relates things to China all the time. It might be hard for non-Chinese student to understand. The course itself is okay, you don't really need to read the textbook as long as you pay attention in class.
If you really want to learn then Prof. Reilly is one of the best professors I have ever had.  Challenging and fulfilling.  Loves it.

No clear grading criteria which makes it difficult to be successful. Doesnt encourage creativity. Super condescending and rude. Thinks shes always right and refuses to accept any other opinions. Would absolutely not recommend this prof.
With this proff, if she doesn't like/agrees with your ideas, topic, or question, you will not get a productive answer or anything more than a belittling reply.

There are so many amazing upper division CMNS courses, unfortunately this is not one of them. Questions are not usually welcome, and assignments are incredibly unclear. prof may appear friendly at first, but is the opposite. the general upset & confusion from the class becomes more obvious every week into the semester.

I wish her icon wasn't green because then I would have known not to take this class. Quite condescending, approximately 120 pages of reading a week, doesn't give clear outlines of her grading criteria and expects you to read her mind of else get a bad grade. Has a different student do the lecture every week, no idea how I can learn this way.

Prof. Reilly is really passionate about what she teaches. This particular course was fairly self-directed in a lot of ways, but she offered great feedback and lots of extra help to anyone who needed it.
Tough grader.
doesnt grade fair and doesnt give out marks easily!
tough grader. expects a lot. doesn't give enough feedback.

One of the most helpful profs I have encountered. He is so helpful for writing papers that he will even provide you with some of the material for it. His class is engaging and really thought provoking sometimes, when he tells stories about his former job with the Ontario Human Rights Commission
Awesome prof. Learn alot and lectures are a blast.
Great prof.  Really helpful.  Don't be afraid to have an opinion.
